title: 'Moscow is trying to hide the major defeat its army is suffering in southern Ukraine'
description: Military expert Dominique Trinquand tells 'Le Monde' that Russian allegations that Ukraine has used a 'dirty bomb' could be a tactical move to mask the reality of what is happening on the frontline.

title: In Hungary, Orban defends Moscow against 'Brussels sanctions'
description: As the country commemorates the 1956 anti-Soviet revolt, the nationalist prime minister, known for his pro-Russian tendencies, intends to use the results of a major 'national consultation' to call for the lifting of sanctions against Moscow.

title: The Russian feminists opposing the war in Ukraine
description: Exiled since March, Russian activist Daria Serenko leads a committed resistance movement opposed to Putin's regime.

title: Sudanese military shoot tear gas at pro-democracy protesters on coup anniversary
description: Thousands of demonstrators took to the streets of Sudan's capital of Khartoum on Tuesday to mark the first anniversary of a military coup that upended the nation’s short-lived transition to democracy.

title: Paris trial kicks off for 'pleasure cruisers' under the orders of Colombian narcos
description: In 2017, three boats traveling from Panama to Australia were intercepted carrying 1.7 tons of cocaine, and now 11 defendants will be tried in Paris over the trafficking.

title: Washington accuses Beijing of espionage on US territory
description: A dozen Chinese spies have been charged in three separate cases, the US Department of Justice revealed.

title: Ash Carter, Obama-era secretary of defense, dies aged 68
description: Harvard University's Kennedy School announced the passing of the former US secretary of defense who opened all military jobs to women.

title: Paris to monitor risk of eavesdropping from city roof antennas
description: The acquisition of 600 telecom sites by the US-based fund Phoenix Tower International is causing concern that listening devices could be installed on rooftops throughout the city.

title: Sudan remains deadlocked, one year after military coup
description: Against the backdrop of the economic crisis and the freezing of international aid, a deteriorating security situation is affecting several regions.

title: Russian court rejects Brittney Griner's appeal of 'traumatic' sentence
description: The American basketballer was detained at a Moscow airport in February after she was found carrying vape cartridges with cannabis oil in her luggage.

title: 'Europe has gone from a gas shortage to overflow in less than three months'
description: While dozens of LNG tankers are queuing up in Spain and the UK, some people are questioning the need to increase fossil fuel storage and transport capacity in the midst of the fight against climate change.

title: Bangladesh: Deadly tropical storm impacts millions
description: At least 24 people were killed and about 10,000 homes damaged in Tropical Storm Sitrang.

title: Adidas ends Kanye West partnership over antisemitic remarks
description: It's the latest company to break ties with the rapper, whose controversial statements have gotten him suspended from Twitter and Instagram.

title: Adidas cuts ties with Kanye West over antisemitic remarks
description: “I can say antisemitic things, and Adidas can’t drop me,” the rapper-designer boasted.

title: Rishi Sunak becomes UK prime minister
description: As Britian's third prime minister in three years, his initial focus will largely be on the country's economic crisis.

title: Far-right PM Giorgia Meloni says Italy committed to EU, NATO and Ukraine
description: In her speech to the Chamber of Deputies, Italy's new leader also rejected links with her country's fascist past.

title: Russia is rebuilding its spy networks throughout Europe
description: Following Russia's invasion of Ukraine, French intelligence detected several agents belonging to Russia's military intelligence services in strategic parts of Europe.

title: 'Split' is Iris Brey's feminist utopia, both on and off screen
description: For her first film, the writer Iris Brey, whose books have brought attention to the issue of sexism on screen, wanted a technical crew made up of a majority of women.

title: Russian spies recruit through French resale site Leboncoin
description: French nationals have been approached via classified ads by agents from intelligence services in Moscow, according to a source in the Ministry of the Interior.

title: Meta confirms WhatsApp outage, working to restore service
description: Users started experiencing problems using the messaging app on Tuesday morning.

title: French government warns of increased risk of Russian espionage
description: French security agencies are ramping up their efforts when it comes to 'citizen conscience', with more than 4,000 awareness-raising operations carried out this year.

title: Xi Jinping loyalist Li Qiang to become Chinese premier
description: The new number two in the Communist Party was rewarded for his loyalty, despite his catastrophic management of the Covid lockdown in Shanghai.

title: French government overcomes no-confidence vote unscathed but shaken
description: The far-right Rassemblement National (RN) voted with the left on a motion of no confidence, but none of the three opposition motions were successful for lack of a majority due to the lack of an absolute majority.

title: New UK PM Rishi Sunak faces 'profound economic crisis'
description: The new British prime minister will lead a country that is entering a recession, with no fiscal room to reduce the shock as it battles the effects of Brexit and previous cuts.

title: German President Steinmeier arrives in Kyiv for surprise visit
description: A few days after cancelling his long-awaited trip to Ukraine's capital for security reasons, Frank-Walter Steinmeier made the trip to Kyiv on Tuesday.

title: Rishi Sunak: History-making prime minister takes reins of a Britain in crisis
description: The new leader is the first person of color to hold the position. He has very little room for maneuver as the country sinks into crisis and the Conservative Party is more divided than ever.

title: US Justice officials: China trying to 'undermine' US judicial system
description: They accused the Chinese government of trying to subert the American justice system and stealing commercial secrets.

title: In Armenia, the construction of a giant statue of Jesus sparks fierce opposition
description: The monumental work of building the largest Christ in the world at an altitude of 2,500 meters has already begun. The brainchild of a powerful Armenian oligarch, the 77-meter-high monument is a subject of controversy as it is located on a classified archaeological site.

title: One year after pledges made in Glasgow, the action against deforestation is still insufficient
description: Commitments  for the protection of forests, notably financial ones, announced at the end of 2021 during the climate conference in Scotland (COP26), have not materialized so far.

title: Macron's thwarted European energy ambitions
description: The EU's failure to find an agreement to contain gas and electricity prices sounds like a disavowal for the French president.

title: French government survives no-confidence votes
description: The centrist government survived three no-confidence votes Monday prompted by opposition lawmakers to protest the use of a special constitutional power to force budget bills through the National Assembly without a vote.

title: Four Palestinians killed in Israeli raid in West Bank
description: Four Palestinians were killed early Tuesday in Nablus and Ramallah in raids by Israeli forces, the Palestinian Health Ministry said. The Israeli army confirmed that they had conducted a large-scale night operation in the West bank.
